newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch closing debt market report.
newsitem.headline: Dutch closing debt market report.

text.p: Dutch bonds closed 10 to 20 cents firmer but some dealers predicted that they would soon surrender some of their recent gains to profit-taking.
"Prices rose but volume was pretty light and it doesn't feel right to me. One strong figure would be enough to drive it back down again," one trader said.
Several dealers noted that 10-year yields were again approaching the 6.20 percent level where they have previously encountered resistance.
Ten-year Dutch yields have not been significantly below this level since early February.
But some players felt that idle stockpiles of cash could soon be set to work in the bond market, helping push yields back towards the six percent level.
"You should not rule out a move to six percent because there is still a lot of cash waiting to be invested," a dealer said.
